bibl.title: Albert Rhudes v. A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound

div1.ab: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle, King County.
In the matter of the application of Albert Rhube for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
div1.p: On reading and filing the petition of Albert Rhude duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appear he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of said King Country, at the city of Seattle, in the County of King, Territory of Washington, and stating wherein the illegality consists, from which it appears that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue; wherefore it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory holdoing terms at Seattle in said King COunty, directed to the said J.H. McGraw, commanding him to have the body of the said Albert Rhude before me, in the said court on the 19th day of November A.D. 1884, November to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Albert Rhude, together with the time and cause of his detention and that he have then and there the said writ. And that in the meantime he be admitted to bail in the sum of one dollars.
div1.ab: Dated 10th day of November A.D. 1884. RS Greene Judge
No. 4155 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding Terms at Seattle
A.P. Hotaling Heo. Application of Albert Rhude for Habeas Corpus
Order for a writ of habeas corpus
Filed Nov 10 1884 James Seavey Clerk By James P Ludlow Deputy. Deputy Clerk
Struve, Haiens amperstand McMicken Attorneys for Rhodes
